newsitem.title: USA: U.S. bulk millfeeds - Prices mostly steady.
newsitem.headline: U.S. bulk millfeeds - Prices mostly steady.

text.p: U.S. millfeed prices were mostly steady on Tuesday in quiet activity, dealers said.
"I am looking at the (mids) market being sideways. I do not see any further declines for the next three to four days," one dealer said.
A St. Louis dealer agreed. "This market is quiet with enough supply to take care of demand and vice versa," he said. "As far as I can tell, there are no real aberrations either way," he said.
One broker said he believed people were using both mids and corn and tying them into their programs.
"I have not seen anything traded," a Carolinas dealer said.
"This market has a life of its own, despite lower corn prices. I do not see end-users buying anything. It appears the trading is going on between the merchants," he added.
